name: phosphorescently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something shines phosphorescently, it gives off phosphorescence (= a kind of weak light that is created in the dark without noticeable heat): The crystal shone phosphorescently as if there were a light inside it. The night sky was glowing phosphorescently.
More examplesFewer examplesThe glass sparkled phosphorescently when the the sunlight caught it.The walls of the old mine began to glow phosphorescently.There was a sudden flash of light and the particles began to glow phosphorescently.
